text: [Music]
hi I'm Elise and welcome back to my
cupcake addiction where today I'm gonna
be showing you how to make a delicious
Oreo cookies and cream ice cream stacked
two-tiered cake there is a lot to
today's video so let's get started to
create this cake I used a 12 inch
presentation board or whatever you want
to display your cake on I've got a 9
inch and a 6 inch cake tin which are
gonna be the size of my two tiers I have
a spoon and a knife I've also got a
baking tray lined with a little bit of
baking or grease proof paper I have a
rolling pin a bowl I've got some mini
Oreos and I've got some regular sized
Oreos I'm using about 6 packets of those
regular sized Oreos I've got some
chocolate melts and I went with dark
chocolate melts today some thickened
cream so for me this is a 35 percent
milk fat cream I've got some of our
homemade Oreo cookie dough I want to
link to that recipe in the description
box below you'll need between 4 and 5
liters of good quality vanilla ice cream
and also just some plain flour to begin
with today we're going to make the two
bases for our ice cream tiers so I'm
using that homemade Oreo cookie dough
sprinkle down a generous amount of flour
and you just want to pat down your
cookie dough just to get the shape
started and then using your rolling pin
you're going to roll that out so it's
about three or four millimeters thick so
don't make this too thin and then you
need to take your larger cake tin and
we're just going to sit it on top and
use of the knife to cut around the
outside so you've got a circle of cookie
the same size as that larger cake tin
now cookies this size can be difficult
to move so just slide a piece of baking
paper under your cookie and use either
side to pick it up like a hammock or
sling to transfer it onto your baking
tray repeat that process exactly using
your smaller tin and then you want to
pop those off into the oven that smaller
cookie is gonna take about 10 to 12
minutes to cook and the larger one's
gonna take about 15 to 17 minutes in a
moderate oven with your bases prepared
you want to smash up your Oreos so I
just do this in ziplock bags and then
really carefully with my rolling pin
kind of pummel them don't overfill the
bags and don't go too crazy or you will
split
them and don't smash them up too small
you want them to be nice and chunky
leave your ice cream out to soften for
about half an hour and then scoop it
into a bowl and then you want to add
about a packet of those crushed Oreo
cookies per liter of ice cream that's my
preferred ratio but you can add more or
less depending on how many cookies you
like stir those Oreos through and when
they're all mixed in you just want to
tip your mix into your six inch cake tin
you can of course use pre-bought cookies
and cream flavored ice cream but I
always prefer to add my own Oreos
because I like a lot of re OHS in my ice
cream cover that one with plastic wrap
pop it off into the freezer and repeat
that process for your larger cake tin
you want to give these at least 12 hours
so they freeze really nice and firm with
your cookie bases cooked and your ice
cream base is completely frozen it's
time to make some ganache so pour your
cream over your chocolate and I will
leave quantities for these in the
description box below and pop that off
into the microwave i microwaved mine for
30 second intervals stirring in between
each one and you'll know it's ready when
that chocolates thoroughly dissolved and
you end up with this really nice creamy
thick chocolate river set that off to
the side for 20 minutes or half an hour
to let it cool right down because you
don't want that to be hot when it goes
onto your ice cream it's time to start
assembling so to remove your ice cream
from the cake tin i just plunged mine
into a sink of warm water for three
seconds
pull it out and wipe off any of that
excess water you need to use a knife
here just to break this seal because
it'll be sort of suctioned onto the cake
tin a little bit and then you're going
to place your cookie base directly onto
the top of your cake working as quickly
as you can take your cake board flip it
upside down and then flip the cake and
cake board over then use your fingers to
press down the center of the base of the
tin and out your ice cream cake should
slide pour over some of your gooey
ganache and working quickly use your
spatula just to smooth it out let it
sort of dribble over the sides a little
bit and then break up your mini Oreo
cookies and just scatter them and stick
them into that can - all the way around
the circumference of your cake pop that
tear back off into the freezer for about
an hour before we come back and do the
top tier the same is with your bottom
tier you want to dunk that in the warm
water and run a knife around before
placing the cookie on top and then I'm
going to use my spatula here just to
place a little bit of that chocolate
ganache onto the base of the cookie
that's going to help it stick to the
bottom tier and not move around make
sure you
support that cookie as you flip this
tear so you just want to flip it and
position it and you will have a little
bit of leeway just sort of move it
around before you remove the tin press
your thumbs into the base of that cake
tin to release your top tier of cake and
your tiered cake is now stacked spatula
on some of your chocolate ganache and
once again you want to spread it
allowing it to go over the sides before
applying some of those mini Oreos all
around the outside edges of your top
tier this is not a difficult cake to
make but it is challenging and that you
have to work really quickly with it
because you're going against the
elements of your melting ice cream and
you also do need to allow a bit of time
I started making mine three days before
I wanted to serve it so on the first day
I created the tiers and froze them solid
on the second day I've stacked it and
then I placed it back in the freezer
covered with a bit of plastic wrap for
another 24 hours before I wanted to
serve it there you've got your delicious
double tiered stacked Oreo cookies and
cream ice cream cake I love this cake I
love cookies and cream and I hope you
guys have enjoyed today's tutorial if
you want to see more from me make sure
you head to the channel and hit the
subscribe button and as always thanks
very much for tuning in to my cupcake
addiction
[Music]
